title: Textile With Chef De Piece, "Le Triomphe de Voltaire", ca. 1790
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave; all z-twist yarns
inscribed: Stamp at one end: "MANUFACTURE DE DUBERN ET COMPe A NANTES BON TEINT No Ds 21" within box with wavy lines. Also: "SB BC" within box and "I", printed after the design was printed on the cloth. All the above in black. In red: "JR" within box and "21" upside down. On the back is a very faint impression "SB BC" within box in black. (This mark is not a 'bleed-through' of the same inscription on the front.)
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Elinor merrell where it was No. 26 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
Repeat H: 103.5cm (40 3/4in.)
Repeat H (plate): 103.5 cm (40 3/4 in.)
Warp x Weft: 147.5 x 94.5 cm (58 1/16 x 37 3/16 in.)
description: A series of scenes associated with Voltaire including Henry IV crowning Voltaire with laurel, an eagle placing a bust of Voltaire on a pedestal and Voltaire's tomb at Scelliere. All in red on white.

participants.person_name: Manufacture de Dubern & Comp. a Nantes

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile With Chef De Piece, "Le Triomphe de Voltaire", ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave; all z-twist yarns. Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-16.
